Text: How the #GOPTaxPlan would create an enormous new "fiscal cliff" in Congress:pic.twitter.com/BaL5eQBm4Y

The #GOPTaxPlan will not pay for itself in economic growth. The truth is, any economic growth from this bill would be swamped by the deficits it creates.https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2017/11/30/senate-gop-tax-plan-would-fall-1-trillion-short-of-trump-administrations-promises-congress-tax-analyst-says/?utm_term=.50c1b2c39b1d …

The #GOPTaxPlan's individual tax provisions are temporary while the tax cuts for corporations are permanent. How does that meet any reasonable definition of "fair"?https://twitter.com/SenateDems/status/936328061976563713 …
It is completely irresponsible to sacrifice our national treasures to offset a tax cut for corporations and the wealthiest Americans. We must #ProtectTheArctic.pic.twitter.com/pFqUm6qlWX

At worst, making the individual tax provisions expire is a sneaky way to increase taxes on American families—all in order to pay for a permanent and expensive corporate tax cut. 

Either way, the result is unconscionable and a total affront to fiscal responsibility.https://twitter.com/SenatorCarper/status/936275841205571584 …

At best, making the individual tax provisions in the #GOPTaxPlan expire is an elaborate scheme to hide the true cost of this bill, obscuring the fact it would add much more to the debt—possibly twice as much—than the $1.5 trillion that’s been advertised.https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2017/11/30/republicans-explain-why-their-tax-cuts-are-temporary-but-not-really-temporary/?utm_term=.d4e7bdf39eb8 …

So up to the Senate Floor the GOP flew, with their sleigh full of skinny repeal, and a partisan tax bill, too. Disguised as a Christmas gift for people like you, but with terrible consequences if the bill does go through.

We should be working together in Congress to open more doors for our nation's graduate students—America's future leaders, experts, innovators and entrepreneurs. The House #GOPTaxPlan does just the opposite. #SaveGradEdhttps://n.pr/2zAvs1K

At the same time, the #GOPTaxPlan would actually increase taxes on millions of Americans beginning next year. By 2027, most people earning less than $75,000 a year would be worse off. 

None of this meets a reasonable definition of "fair."https://twitter.com/SenatorCarper/status/935945881941106688 …

Within 10 years, more than 77% of the tax cuts in the #GOPTaxPlan would go to the wealthiest 5% of Americans. Nearly 62% of the tax cuts would go to the wealthiest 1% of Americans.http://wapo.st/2zGAlar?tid=ss_tw&utm_term=.22f3170ab7e4 …

Kathleen Hartnett White's nomination was just reported out of the EPW Committee. If she is confirmed by the Senate, I believe we will have failed in our responsibility as United States Senators to provide advice and consent, and we will have failed the American people.
Kathleen Hartnett White has called for the repeal of the Renewable Fuels Standard repeatedly over the past decade, stating the program is "counterproductive," "ethically offensive" and "destructive."
Kathleen Hartnett White has repeatedly contradicted the accepted views of previous Republican and Democratic administrations alike about the health effects of air pollution.pic.twitter.com/F2S7mCwPip
Kathleen Hartnett White has said – several times – that fossil fuels ended slavery.pic.twitter.com/THCpn6MMTx

Kathleen Hartnett White has compared the views of those who believe that human activity is causing climate change to those of "pagans" and "communists." She's suggested that policies to reduce global warming pollution could lead to poverty and even concentration camps.
Kathleen Hartnett White refers to renewable energy sources as a "false hope" and "parasitic." She's called repeatedly for the repeal of the solar and wind tax credits.

The Council on Environmental Quality's responsibility and influence is considerable and consequential. That's why I'm deeply disappointed in the nomination of Kathleen Hartnett White. I cannot urge my colleagues more strongly to oppose her nomination.

In 1986, enacting tax reform in Congress took years of public hearings and bipartisan negotiations. The idea that a permanent and enduring tax reform plan can come to fruition in mere weeks is the triumph of man's hope over experience.https://twitter.com/SenatorCarper/status/935879709635829763 …

Any tax bill that's purely partisan, written in the dark and rushed to the finish line is bound to be poorly designed and riddled with inadvertent errors. A flawed process results in a flawed product.https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/27/us/politics/senate-tax-bills-potential-hurdle-republicans.html …

The #GOPTaxPlan process that's been followed over the past few days makes a mockery of the bipartisan tradition of the @SenateFinance Committee. We can—and, more important, we should—do better than this.
This week we learned that Republican efforts to pass a #BillionairesFirst tax plan would also include a sleight of hand maneuver that will begin dismantling our country's health care system.

When Republicans unveiled their tax reform proposal last Friday, we knew they'd rejected our pleas for true bipartisan negotiations, and chosen instead to force through a bill in mere days that would remake our entire economy.

Last night, Republicans on @SenateFinance approved a bill to repeal a critical part of the Affordable Care Act, and blow a hole of at least $1.5 trillion in our federal deficit over the next 10 years in order to give millions of dollars in tax breaks to the wealthiest Americans.

Support for the clean energy sector led to more than $507 billion in investments. Recent increases in fuel efficiency standards would cut 6 billion metric tons of CO2, and save Americans $1.7 trillion at the pump.https://twitter.com/SenatorCarper/status/931231038159847424 …

Despite what the Trump Administration may say, our reduced emissions and economic growth isn't a coincidence. Over the past eight years, the federal government used a combination of economic incentives and environmental targets to spur clean energy investments and cut emissions.https://twitter.com/EPWDems/status/931230405935628288 …

I encourage my colleagues to vote no on Bill Wehrum's nomination to be EPA's Assistant Administrator for Air and Radiation.https://twitter.com/EPWDems/status/928649682242490368 …

Bill Wehrum believes there's no justification for EPA to regulate the largest sources of mercury and air toxics pollution—even though power companies have already bought, paid for and installed control technology on all power plants without hiking electricity prices.

Bill Wehrum believes there's no justification for @EPA to regulate the largest sources of mercury and air toxics pollution—pollution that settles in our lakes and rivers, accumulates in our fish, and makes them too dangerous to eat.

Bill Wehrum believes there's no justification for @EPA to regulate the largest sources of mercury and air toxic pollution—pollution that pediatricians tell us damages children's brains and could affect up to 600,000 newborns every year.
Bill Wehrum has spent most of his career fighting to dismantle the federal environmental protections that so many states, including Delaware, depend on to clean up toxic air pollution.
Toxic air pollution gets into the air we breathe, gets into the food we eat, builds up in our bodies without our knowledge, and can lead to cancer, mental impairment and even death.

Much of our country's ongoing efforts to clean up air pollution hinges on making sure that every state plays by the rules and does their fair share to reduce air pollution. That includes dangerous toxic pollution like mercury.

In one of those instances, the courts faulted @EPA's lack of action to reduce mercury and air toxic pollution emissions from electric power plants.https://twitter.com/SenatorCarper/status/928644716136222720 …

The number of times courts have overturned regulations that Bill Wehrum helped to craft at @EPA? 27.

That's 27 times that the courts determined the rules Bill Wehrum put in place didn't follow the law or adequately protect public health.
Throughout his career, Bill Wehrum has clearly shown that he's dismissive of the science at the core of @EPA's actions to protect public health
Americans deserve @EPA leaders who believe in sound science. Americans need EPA leaders who will listen to our medical experts when it comes to our health.

Never has an @EPA nominee so consistently under-estimated the risks of chemical exposures to the most vulnerable among us—not until Michael Dourson. #ScienceForSale

TCE (an industrial solvent) is found in consumer products despite its universally recognized links to cancer. Michael Dourson was paid by manufacturers to say protections against TCE should be weakened. #ScienceForSalepic.twitter.com/bLtE0l3B6X

Chlorpyrifos (an insecticide used on crops and golf courses) is a neurotoxin that causes nausea, dizziness and headaches. It poses a serious health threat to children. #ScienceForSalepic.twitter.com/DEUT52W6dC

When Alachlor (a herbicide) contaminates drinking water, it can lead to kidney damage, liver damage and various forms of cancer. It’s banned across Europe. Michael Dourson wants to weaken protections against it. #ScienceForSalepic.twitter.com/8jnI1QoNei

Acrylamide (commonly found in fried foods) is linked to various cancers. Industry paid Michael Dourson to conduct an independent review of acrylamide, and he determined that it's safe at levels 25x higher. #ScienceForSalepic.twitter.com/VUDjRuziCf

1,4-Dioxane (an industrial strength solvent used in manufacturing for greases, dyes and varnishes) can cause nausea, headaches and lead to liver and kidney damage. #ScienceForSalepic.twitter.com/kmkLC9lyMB

Short-term exposure to 1-Bromopropane (used in in degreasers, cleaners and industrial lubricants) can cause developmental and reproductive harm. Long-term exposure can lead to reproductive, kidney and liver damage and lung cancer.pic.twitter.com/2xTCbRAro9

In #2013 I met Delaware's own Terrel H. Bell Award winner, @PrincipalNauman of Shields Elementary http://ow.ly/i/4aFeg  #yearinreview
In #2013, the House and Senate came together on a #budget deal for the first time since 2009. #yearinreview
In #2013, we continued to see #environmental & #economic benefits of Diesel Emissions Reduction Act http://1.usa.gov/Jzn05e  #Yearinreview
In #2013, I chaired @SenateHSGAC hearings to review @DHSgov on its 10th anniversary. #DHSat10 #yearinreview
In #2013, I introduced legislation to admit Washington, #DC as the 51st state & provide the district with full voting rights. #yearinreview
In #2013, I joined a bipartisan group of Senators in urging President Obama to fill vacant Senate confirmed positions. #yearinreview
In #2013, I sent a letter to President Obama urging him to fill open Inspectors General vacancies to increase oversight. #yearinreview
In #2013, I welcomed Jeh Johnson to be the new Secretary @DHSgov. A capable leader in a critical position. #yearinreview
In #2013, I pushed for Sylvia Mathews Burwell to be confirmed as the new Director at the #OMB. #yearinreview
In #2013, I held three @senateHSGAC hearings to look at the state of the #postal service and how it should be fixed. #yearinreview
In #2013, @SenateHSGAC reported out the #DATA Act to improve the transparency of federal spending #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/1995SPy
In #2013, I chaired an @SenateHSGAC hearing to prevent prescription drug abuse in #Medicare #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/1995KPO
In #2013, I worked to protect #Veterans from being targeted by predatory private universities #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/1fhjOoO
In #2013, I became the Chair of the Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee #yearinreview @SenateHSGAC
In #2013, @SenateHSGAC fought to include PRIME Act in SGR legislation to prevent improper payments in #Medicare & #Medicaid #yearinreview
In #2013, I urged the House and Senate to increase funding for aid to individuals affected by Super Storm #Sandy http://1.usa.gov/1eiVUNt
In #2013, I cosponsored Violence Against Women Act to protect women & families throughout the US. #VAWA #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/18vgMOL
In #2013, I joined @Sen_JoeManchin @SenatorBurr @SenAlexander @TomCoburn on perm fix 4 student loans #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/1kPnxeD
In #2013, I urged President Obama to fix the backlog of disability benefits at the #VA. #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/18M7J75
In #2013, I honored #vet sacrifices by sponsoring legislation to prevent people from falsely claiming military medals http://1.usa.gov/1bL1a81
In #2013, I protected #veterans ensuring the term #GI Bill is not used inappropriately by nongov groups #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/1fhbUfc
In #2013, @ErnestMoniz became our new Secretary at the Department of @Energy
In #2013, I supported @GinaEPA McCarthy as the new Administrator @EPA. She’s doing a great job! #yearinreview
In #2013, I welcomed @JohnBoozman as the new cochair of the Senate #Recycling caucus #yearinreview
In #2013, I introduced a bill to monitor mercury levels to protect pregnant mothers+unborn children #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/1eiKoS0
In #2013, I teamed with @ChuckGrassley and @SenRockefeller on an amendment to SGR to provide coverage for #diabetes prevention #yearinreview
In#2013 I introduced legislation to expand counseling & treatment for obesity w/ @lisamurkowski, @BillCassidy, @RepRonKind #yearinreview
In #2013, I pushed to ensure #DE has resources needed to implement impt water infrastructure projects #yearinreview http://1.usa.gov/19NCzMP
In #2013, I introduced Incentivizing Offshore Wind Power Act to put wind off #DE coast to work creating clean renewable energy #yearinreview
In #2013, I conducted oversight of #Medicare & #Medicaid to ensure taxpayers & patients get the best care for their money. #yearinreview
In #2013, I supported the repeal and replace of the SGR to get better results for money spent on healthcare #yearinreview
In #2013, the Lady Blue Hens had an incredible basketball season! Thanks for an unforgettable year. #yearinreview
In #2013, Delaware completed the federally funded I-95/Route 1 interchange project alleviating congestion for 1000s of drivers #yearinreview
In #2013, Delaware’s own Jill Syzmanski was named National History Teacher of the Year #yearinreview #netde
In #2013, I helped secure a Huey Helicopter to make its home in Delaware #yearinreview
In #2013, I awarded a Congressional Gold Medal to the family of Mr. Odell Lee, a Montford Point Marine. #yearinreview
In #2013, I helped award a Congressional Gold Medal to Mr. Fred Johnson, a Tuskegee Airman in New Castle. #yearinreview
In #2013, my office nominated more than 40 stellar Delaware HS seniors to our nation’s service academies. #yearinreview
In #2013, my @Chrysler minivan hit 358,000 miles! That’s a lot of ground to cover in #netDE. #yearinreview
In #2013, my office helped more than 2,400 constituent cases get resolved #yearinreview
In #2013, the Michael N. Castle Trail along the C&D Canal opened to the public #yearinreview
In #2013, Delaware welcomed the new D-league team, the Delaware 87ers! #yearinreview
In #2013, my staff and I met with constituents at yet another wonderful @DEStateFair #yearinreview
In #2013, I fought for & secured Hurricane Sandy funding to help rebuild storm-damaged beaches in DE #yearinreview
In #2013, I joined @KenSalazar & @VP to announce the First State National Monument #yearinreview
In #2013, @ChrisCoons, @JohnCarneyDE and I hosted job fairs in DE in all 3 counties. #yearinreview
Over the next 7 days, I'll be looking back on 2013 in my own #yearinreview. Your personal memories are welcomed!

6. Reduce fedl property/energy use. Elim extraneous govt prop & improving fedl energy use will save $, cut #deficit: http://1.usa.gov/vYOmSp
5. Improve govt IT. Taxpayers lose hundreds of millions $ ea yr b/c of inefficient fedl IT mgmt. My bill fixes prob: http://1.usa.gov/vYOmSp
4. Elim+recover improper payments. Fedl paymt errors cost billions ea yr. Need new req's 2 prevent them, like IPERA: http://1.usa.gov/vYOmSp
3. Strengthen #Medicare & #Medicaid. #StopWasteandFraud in these programs w my FAST Act to save $, safeguard progs: http://1.usa.gov/vYOmSp .
2. Close #tax gap. Difference b/w what taxpayers owe & what they pay costs U.S. billions ea year. Collect+simplify: http://1.usa.gov/vYOmSp .
1. Implement #USPS reform. Bipartisan #Supercommittee suppt 4 postal reform will save $ & protect millions of jobs: http://1.usa.gov/skjxMi .

6th: Bill allows USPS 2 partner w state/local govts 2 offer govt services in post offices. Fed govt already can: http://1.usa.gov/oqEEYf .
5th: Plan allows USPS 2 experiment w/ sale of non-postal products that utilize USPS' nationwide delivery/logistics network 2 earn add'l $.
4th: Plan compels labor 2 take USPS financial situation into acct when formulating employee contracts. Full summary: http://1.usa.gov/oqEEYf
3rd: Plan gives USPS freedom 2 decide whether 2 close unneeded post offices/distrib ctrs w/o Congress micro-mgmt: http://1.usa.gov/oqEEYf .
